wikipedia_page.main: Major General Sir Newton James Moore,  (17 May 1870 – 28 October 1936) was an Australian politician, businessman and army officer. He served as the eighth Premier of Western Australia from 1906 to 1910 and, following service in the First World War, was a member of the House of Commons of the United Kingdom from 1918 to 1932. He was the father of Sir Rodney Moore.

response: *1870 – Newton Moore, Australian politician, 8th Premier of Western Australia (d. 1936)
*1936 – Newton Moore, Australian soldier and politician, 8th Premier of Western Australia (b. 1870)

Education is compulsory in Western Australia between the ages of six and seventeen, corresponding to primary and secondary school. Schools that serve high school students in the area include Bunbury Senior High School, Newton Moore Senior High School, Manea Senior College, College Row School (K–12 education support), Australind Senior High School, Eaton Community College, Dalyellup College (K–12), Bunbury Cathedral Grammar School (K–12), Bunbury Catholic College, Grace Christian School, and Our Lady of Mercy College.
*Newton Moore, Mayor of Bunbury, Minister for Lands and Agriculture, 8th Premier of Western Australia, Major General (WWI), member of the House of Commons of the United Kingdom

In 1906, the state premier Newton Moore made Mitchell an honorary minister for agricultural expansion. In 1909 he was promoted, being given the portfolios of lands and agriculture. He recruited William Lowrie as director of agriculture.

In 1981, Brian Burke defeated Ron Davies to become opposition leader. At the 19 February 1983 state election, he became the state's 23rd premier (and its third youngest after John Scaddan and Newton Moore), ending almost nine years of conservative coalition government which had commenced under Sir Charles Court (1974–1982), and was completed by Ray O'Connor (1982–1983).

response: Wilson was Minister for Works for the duration of Cornthwaite Rason's government, from August 1905 until May 1906.  He might then have become premier but stood aside in favour of Newton Moore.  In Moore's ministry Wilson was initially appointed Colonial Treasurer, Minister for Agriculture and Minister for Education.  By June 1909 he had relinquished these portfolios, and he was then appointed Minister for Works.  For part of 1910, he was acting premier while Moore was absent in England.
* Major-General Sir Newton Moore KCMG (1870–1936), eighth Premier of Western Australia, World War I general, member of the UK House of Commons
